column1: Presidencia Roque Sáenz Peña (normally known as Sáenz Peña) is a city in the province of Chaco
column2: Argentina. It is the second largest in the province. It is located 170 kilometres (110 mi) west-northwest of the provincial capital Resistencia
column3: on the main rail and road route across northern Argentina to Salta. The city has a population of 76

column1: Sáenz Peña was founded in 1912 and has developed as a commercial and industrial centre serving the surrounding agricultural region of the Gran Chaco plains.
National University of the Chaco Austral
Municipal information: Municipal Affairs Federal Institute (IFAM)
